dataset_description.documentation: General description of the dataset (collection of all IDSs within the given database entry). Main description text to be put in ids_properties/comment

dataset_description.data_entry.machine.documentation: Name of the experimental device to which this data is related

dataset_description.data_entry.pulse_typ.documentation: Type of the data entry, e.g. "pulse", "simulation", ...

dataset_description.dd_version.documentation: Version of the physics data dictionary of this dataset

dataset_description.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

dataset_description.ids_properties.comme.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

dataset_description.ids_properties.creat.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

dataset_description.ids_properties.homog.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

dataset_description.ids_properties.occur.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

dataset_description.ids_properties.prove.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which the provenance is given. The provenance information applies to the whole structure below the IDS node. For documenting provenance information for the whole IDS, set the size of this array of structure to 1 and leave the child "path" node empty
Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the provenance information applies to the whole IDS.

List of sources used to import or calculate this node, identified as explained below. In case the node is the result of of a calculation / data processing, the source is an input to the process described in the "code" structure at the root of the IDS. The source can be an IDS (identified by a URI or a persitent identifier, see syntax in the link below) or non-IDS data imported directly from an non-IMAS database (identified by the command used to import the source, or the persistent identifier of the data source). Often data are obtained by a chain of processes, however only the last process input are recorded here. The full chain of provenance has then to be reconstructed recursively from the provenance information contained in the data sources.

dataset_description.ids_properties.provi.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

dataset_description.ids_properties.sourc.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...). Superseeded by the new provenance structure.

dataset_description.ids_properties.versi.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS
Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

dataset_description.imas_version.documentation: Version of the IMAS infrastructure used to produce this data entry. Refers to the global IMAS repository which links to versions of every infrastructure tools

dataset_description.parent_entry.documentation: Definition of the parent data entry, if the present data entry has been generated by applying a given workflow to a unique parent entry

dataset_description.parent_entry.machine.documentation: Name of the experimental device to which this data is related

dataset_description.parent_entry.pulse_t.documentation: Type of the data entry, e.g. "pulse", "simulation", ...

dataset_description.pulse_time_begin.documentation: Date and time (UTC) at which the pulse started on the experiment, expressed in a human readable form (ISO 8601) : the format of the string shall be : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Example : 2020-07-24T14:19:00Z

dataset_description.pulse_time_begin_epo.documentation: Time at which the pulse started on the experiment, expressed in Unix Epoch time. Temporarily represented as two integers, since for the moment IMAS is missing 64bits long integers to represent epoch time with nanoseconds resolution
Elapsed nanoseconds since the time in seconds indicated above
Elapsed seconds since the Unix Epoch time (01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC)

dataset_description.pulse_time_end_epoch.documentation: Time at which the pulse ended on the experiment, expressed in Unix Epoch time. Temporarily represented as two integers, since for the moment IMAS is missing 64bits long integers to represent epoch time with nanoseconds resolution
Elapsed nanoseconds since the time in seconds indicated above
Elapsed seconds since the Unix Epoch time (01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC)

dataset_description.simulation.documentation: Description of the general simulation characteristics, if this data entry has been produced by a simulation. Several nodes describe typical time-dependent simulation with a time evolution as the main loop

dataset_description.simulation.comment_a.documentation: Comment made at the end of a simulation

dataset_description.simulation.comment_b.documentation: Comment made when launching a simulation

dataset_description.simulation.time_begi.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "time_begin"

dataset_description.simulation.time_curr.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "time_current"

dataset_description.simulation.time_end_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "time_end"

dataset_description.simulation.time_rest.documentation: Time of the last restart done during the simulation
Index in the error_description list for "time_restart"

dataset_description.simulation.time_step.documentation: Time interval between main steps, e.g. storage step (if relevant and constant)
Index in the error_description list for "time_step"

dataset_description.simulation.workflow.documentation: Description of the workflow which has been used to produce this data entry (e.g. copy of the Kepler MOML if using Kepler)
